edu.stanford.math.plex

Class RDirectBufferData

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.math.plex.PointData
      • edu.stanford.math.plex.RDirectBufferData

  • public class RDirectBufferData
extends PointData
    The RDirectBufferData is a mechanism for transforming an R distance matrix into a PointData.
    Version:
    $Id$

    • Constructor Detail

      • RDirectBufferData

        public RDirectBufferData(int count,
                 java.nio.ByteBuffer buf)
        Use a pre-allocated buffer of doubles as the distance matrix. The ByteBuffer passed to the constructor will be viewed as a DoubleBuffer, which will let us use the capacity function to get the max entry.

        Parameters:
        count - The upper bound on i. i is 1-indexed
        buf - ByteBuffer instance to be used.

    • Method Detail

      • distance

        public double distance(int p1,
              int p2)
        Return the distance between the two points using the external data, which is stored as 0-based columns.

        Specified by:
        distance in class PointData
        Parameters:
        p1 - the first point
        p2 - the second point
        Returns:
        the distance between p1 and p2

      • count

        public int count()
        Description copied from class: PointData
        The number of points in this data set.

        Indexing begins from 1, not 0, which means that the points go from 1 to count(), inclusive. It is acceptable for an implementation to allow points to be added.

        Specified by:
        count in class PointData
        Returns:
        The number of points in the data set.
